channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Regions - Africa
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Ethiopia shows massive renewable energy surge
Inside Africa's largest solar farm
item.description: In the sleepy, sun-blasted town of De Aar in central South Africa, a mighty force is stirring.

item.title: How Kenya has become a geothermal superpower?
item.description: Kenya is a global superpower of the flower trade, and Oserian, one of the largest fair-trade flower farms in the country, is a major reason why.

item.title: Egypt to hand over EgyptAir crash victims' remains
Is genocide looming in South Sudan?
item.description: The situation in Syria leaves one in despair, but there is another genocide that is looming and can be prevented in South Sudan.

item.title: Libyans use 'leftovers' to defeat ISIS
Reason for Cairo blast unclear
item.description: Security fears swept across Cairo on Monday as police probed the deadly bomb blast that ripped through a Coptic church the day before.

item.title: SA scientists uncover clue to cancer
item.description: Scientists in South Africa have found a link between Malaria resistance and the genes that lead to metastasis.

item.title: Northeastern Nigeria: Center of forgotten crisis
item.description: There is no escaping US politics these days. Even in remote northeastern Nigeria, where I have just spent two months with the International Rescue Committee, most of the televisions are set to international news networks which are covering the presidential transition in excruciating detail.

item.title: President rejects election results
item.description: After his defeat in the December 1 election, Gambian President Yahya Jammeh declared his "total rejection" of the results and called for his country to vote again.

item.title: Ghana election: Incumbent concedes
item.description: Ghanaian President John Mahama has conceded defeat to Nana Akufo-Addo in the recently concluded elections, a spokesman for the President-elect told CNN on Friday.

item.title: The volunteers trialing HIV vaccine
item.description: Every day Luyanda Ngcobo's routine is the same: It starts with a trip to the back cupboard, where, safely hidden away is a bottle of nevirapine, an anti-retroviral (ARV) pill he has to take twice a day for the rest of his life.

item.title: Inside Africa's tribal traditions
item.description: What makes your culture unique?

item.title: Patients escaped Kenya mental facility during strike
Inside whites-only town
Why is optimism rising in Africa?
Teen girls prepare for space launch
item.description: Teenage girls have designed Africa's first private satellite due to launch into space in 2017. It's hoped it can monitor and find answers to South Africa's drought crisis.

item.title: CNN Africa profiles movers and shakers
The 81-year-old BMW designer
Disappeared in Africa's North Korea
item.description: Aster Yohannes is believed to be in solitary confinement in Eritrea, which thousands of people flee annually to escape widespread abuses.

item.title: Ethiopian runner fears for his life
item.description: Olympic runner Feyisa Lilesa speaks about how he was able to protest his government at the 2016 Rio Summer Games.

item.title: 60-Second Vacation: Nairobi, Kenya
item.description: From downtown Nairobi to its stunning national park, take a 60-second mini tour of Kenya's capital. Video filmed by Alex Lee.

item.title: Rwanda's vision City to house 25,000
Who are Africa's most dangerous terror groups?
item.description: Deadly bombings, mass kidnappings and shocking massacres. CNN's Robyn Kriel explores the continent's deadliest terror organizations.

item.title: How Sierra Leone plans to bounce back after Ebola
item.description: It was at the epicenter of the 2014 Ebola outbreak. With the outbreak officially over, Sierra Leone is looking to rebrand its image and rebuild its economy.

item.title: Fearless entrepreneurs dreaming big in Nigeria
item.description: Media entrepreneurs Mo Abudu and Kene Mkparu are turning their dreams into reality in Africa's most populous country. CNN's Jim Stenman reports.

item.title: The photographer giving people a voice
item.description: Top Instagrammer Steven Chikosi is on a mission to tell stories of daily life in Zimbabwe.

item.title: Ivory Coast's alternative to Uber
Comics showcase African culture
E-transaction in South Africa
